meanings.definition: To expose oneself to the sun's rays.
meanings.sent1: The cat enjoys sunning on the windowsill every morning.
meanings.sent2: People often feel relaxed when sunning on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The lazy dog was caught sunning itself on the porch again.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden were sunning their petals in the afternoon light.
meanings.sent5: The lizard was sunning on the rock, soaking up the warmth.

meanings.sent1: After swimming, the children were sunning themselves on the grass.
meanings.sent2: Tourists love sunning by the pool at the resort.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat was sunning on the balcony, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent4: The turtle slowly crawled out of the water, ready to start sunning.
meanings.sent5: The picnic blanket was spread out for sunning and relaxing in the park.

meanings.definition: To dry or warm in the sun.
meanings.sent1: She was sunning her wet clothes on the line to dry.
meanings.sent2: The towels were sunning on the deck after a swim.
meanings.sent3: The bread dough was left sunning by the window to rise.
meanings.sent4: The cat was sunning its fur to help it dry faster.
meanings.sent5: The old books were sunning on the shelf to remove the musty smell.
